title: Extreme Sailing Series: Oman Sail teams set for podium finish
text:
Extreme Sailing Series: Oman Sail teams set for podium finish The Wave, Muscat races ahead in Act 7 of the Extreme Sailing Series October 05, 2015 
Leigh McMillan and his crew on The Wave, Muscat (TWM) are on the verge of establishing a new record for the biggest win of an Extreme Sailing Series (ESS) leg after a high octane day on the Bosphorus Straits in Istanbul, Turkey, on Saturday, which also saw Oman Air climb to second spot in Act 7. 
With one day’s racing remaining, TWM has a 35-point lead over Oman Sail challenger Oman Air and looks set to beat the biggest win margin in recent years, which was set in Singapore in 2013 when Alinghi put 35 points between it and the rest of the fleet. 
The two-time ESS champion McMillan said he was 'super happy' with his team's performance, but warned against easing back on the final day when a historic fourth win in a row after wins in Cardiff, Hamburg and St Petersburg, was so close. 
Oman Air in action in Istanbul, Turkey on Saturday 
“We have sailed well here, but we need to keep it up on the final day because we need this win if we are to stand a chance of taking the series, which is what we set out to do at the start of the year,” said McMillan. 
He added, “So far, we have had some good results, so I am super happy. The whole crew is happy and relaxed, though a bit exhausted because we have had 15-20 knots every day. It’s been a challenge to keep energy levels high.” 
Of the 23 races completed so far over the past three days, TWM has achieved a remarkable 11 wins with a total of 19 podium places, while Stevie Morrison’s Oman Air has to date posted 13 podium spots, including one outright win, which according to the skipper reflects a strong performance. 
“We are loving Istanbul and feel we deserve these results because we always knew we had good sailors on board and have worked very hard all season. But I have never made it to the podium in this format, which I am keen to do with this team,” said Morrison. “We feel confident that we can carry on sailing well and if we do that and continue enjoying some good fortune, the result will take care of itself.” 
Oman Air is heading for its best result of the series. Its previous best was fourth in Muscat earlier this year and Ali al Balushi, who joined the ESS for the last event in Sydney in 2014, describes the prospect of finishing on the podium as ‘something huge’. 
“We are fighting hard and pushing hard all the time. We have been improving with each event. We are sailing well and loving it. Finishing second will be huge,” Balushi said. 
Results [Act 7]: 1 The Wave, Muscat (203 pts), 2 Oman Air (168), 3 SAP Extreme Sailing Team (159), 4 GAC Pindar (145), 5 Lino Sonego Team Italia (137), 6 Gazprom Team Russia (121), 7 Red Bull Sailing Team (120), 8 Team Turx (119). Similar content
